classmethod get_new_kfold_data(model_list, params, data_file_suffix)[source]ïƒ

Putting new data into each k-fold trained model: we donâ€™t need to split the new data into folds. We just need to get the predictions for each fold and plot them.

classmethod get_new_tt_data(model, params, data_file_suffix)[source]ïƒ

Get new data by running through trained model for a train/test model.

Parameters:

  • model (nn.Module) â€“ The trained model.

  • sources (list) â€“ List of sources to get data from. [tabular1source csv, tabular2source csv, image csv]

Return type:

return train_reals, train_preds, val_reals, val_preds, metric_values

classmethod get_tt_data_from_model(model)[source]ïƒ

Get the data from a train/test model.

Parameters:

model (nn.Module) â€“ The trained model.

Returns:

  • train_reals (torch.Tensor) â€“ The real values for the training set.

  • train_preds (torch.Tensor) â€“ The predicted values for the training set.

  • val_reals (torch.Tensor) â€“ The real values for the validation set.

  • val_preds (torch.Tensor) â€“ The predicted values for the validation set.

  • metric_values (dict) â€“ The values of the metrics for the model.

get_kfold_numbers()[source]ïƒ

Gets the lists of train_reals, train_preds, val_reals, val_preds for all folds and saves to self. Gets the altogether list of val_reals and val_preds over folds and saves to self. Gets metrics to put in the plot titles, adds to metrics list.

Return type:

None
